io.neba.api.rendering

Interface BeanRenderer


  • public interface BeanRenderer
    Renders any object to a string using an internal template mechanism, such as velocity.
    The view used to render the object is derived from the object's type and the provided view hint.
    Author:
    Olaf Otto

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String render(Object bean) 
      String render(Object bean, Map<String,Object> context) 
      String render(Object bean, String viewHint) 
      String render(Object bean, String viewHint, Map<String,Object> context) 

    • Method Detail

      • render

        String render(Object bean)
        Parameters:
        bean - must not be null.
        Returns:
        the rendered bean, or null if no view was found for the bean.

      • render

        String render(Object bean,
            String viewHint)
        Parameters:
        bean - must not be null.
        viewHint - can be null.
        Returns:
        the rendered bean, or null if no view was found for the bean.

      • render

        String render(Object bean,
            String viewHint,
            Map<String,Object> context)
        Parameters:
        bean - must not be null.
        viewHint - can be null.
        context - additional objects to be exposed in the rendering context. can be null. It is not possible to override variables provided e.g. by bindings values providers in this context. If a key in the given context already exists in the scripting bindings an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        the rendered bean, or null if no view was found for the bean.

      • render

        String render(Object bean,
            Map<String,Object> context)
        Parameters:
        bean - must not be null.
        context - additional objects to be exposed in the rendering context. can be null. It is not possible to override variables provided e.g. by bindings values providers in this context. If a key in the given context already exists in the scripting bindings an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        the rendered bean, or null if no view was found for the bean.
